world_news:
• [Nov 25, 3:00 AM] Ukraine War: A major Russian missile and drone strike targeted Kyiv, causing significant damage to infrastructure and resulting in multiple casualties. This is the second major assault on the capital this month.
  • [Nov 25, 9:00 AM] Gaza: Heavy rains and subsequent flooding have inundated the makeshift camps for displaced Palestinians in Gaza, worsening the already dire humanitarian crisis and leading to fears of disease outbreaks.
  • [Nov 25, 12:00 PM] Syria: In the Alawite heartland, Syrian security forces opened fire to disperse competing protests, indicating rising tensions and instability within the region.
  • [Nov 25, 10:00 AM] US-Russia Diplomacy: High-level officials from the United States and Russia convened in Abu Dhabi for peace talks concerning the ongoing war in Ukraine, marking a rare diplomatic engagement between the two nations.
  • [Nov 24, 8:00 PM] Yemen: Houthi militants launched a series of drone and missile attacks targeting commercial vessels in the Red Sea, further escalating maritime security concerns and disrupting global trade routes.
  • [Nov 25, 11:00 AM] Sudan: Intense fighting has been reported in the city of Al-Fashir in North Darfur, leading to a significant number of civilian casualties and exacerbating the humanitarian emergency in the region.
  • [Nov 25, 1:00 PM] Iran: The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) has reported that Iran has further increased its stockpile of highly enriched uranium, raising international concerns about the country's nuclear ambitions.
  • [Nov 24, 10:00 PM] North Korea: North Korea conducted a test of a new solid-fuel hypersonic missile, in a move that has been condemned by the US and its allies as a violation of UN Security Council resolutions.
  • [Nov 25, 8:00 AM] Global Economy: Oil prices have surged in response to the escalating conflicts in the Middle East and Ukraine, with Brent crude futures rising by 3% due to fears of supply disruptions.
  • [Nov 25, 2:00 PM] Somalia: A car bomb exploded at a busy intersection in Mogadishu, killing at least 15 people and injuring dozens more in an attack attributed to the al-Shabaab militant group.
us_news:
• [Nov 25, 9:30 AM] Trump's Potential BBC Lawsuit: The Hill published an opinion piece analyzing the potential legal and political risks for Donald Trump should he move forward with a threatened libel lawsuit against the BBC.
  • [Nov 25, 7:23 AM] Trump's Conflict with BBC: Reuters reports on the escalating conflict between President Trump and the BBC, noting that the U.S. Federal Communications Commission (FCC) has formally questioned the broadcaster, potentially threatening its global reach.
  • [Nov 24, 8:30 PM] Former Senator Doug Jones to Run for Alabama Governor: Former U.S. Senator Doug Jones officially announced his candidacy for the 2026 Alabama gubernatorial race after filing the necessary campaign paperwork.
  • [Nov 24, 7:04 PM] Thanksgiving Travel Advisory: In the wake of a government shutdown that caused major air travel disruptions, AP News has issued a guide for Thanksgiving travelers, advising them on how to navigate potential residual delays and cancellations.
  • [Nov 24, 6:30 PM] US Military Aircraft in Puerto Rico: A significant number of U.S. military jets and helicopters were observed at the former Roosevelt Roads naval base in Ceiba, Puerto Rico, on Monday.
  • [Nov 24, 5:16 PM] Chauncey Billups Pleads Not Guilty: Portland Trail Blazers coach Chauncey Billups entered a plea of not guilty in a Brooklyn federal court to charges alleging he profited from rigged poker games.
  • [Nov 24, 2:31 PM] DOJ Seeks Epstein Grand Jury Transcripts: The Department of Justice renewed its legal efforts, filing a request to unseal the grand jury transcripts from the sex trafficking cases against Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
  • [Nov 24, 9:33 AM] BBC Chief Faces Lawmakers: The chair of the BBC board appeared before British lawmakers to defend the corporation's response to allegations of bias in its news coverage.
  • [Nov 24, 2:50 AM] Trump's Government Efficiency Department Disbanded: An official confirmed that the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE), an initiative by President Donald Trump, has been formally disbanded eight months before its charter was set to expire.
  • [Nov 23, 11:15 AM] US Holiday Shopping Season Kicks Off: The official start to the US holiday shopping season began this weekend, with retailers offering deep discounts to lure in customers amid concerns about inflation and consumer spending.
tech_news:
• [Nov 24, 2:10 PM] AWS's AI Infrastructure for US Government: AWS announced a $50 billion investment to build AI infrastructure for the U.S. government, aiming to enhance capabilities in areas from cybersecurity to drug discovery.
  • [Nov 24, 10:52 AM] Jony Ive and Sam Altman's AI Hardware Prototype: Jony Ive and Sam Altman revealed they have a prototype for a new AI hardware device, which they described as more 'peaceful and calm' than the iPhone. The device is expected to launch within two years.
  • [Nov 24, 9:18 AM] US Banks Assess Data Theft: Major U.S. banks, including JPMorgan Chase, Citi, and Morgan Stanley, are investigating a data breach at a New York-based financial tech firm that could have exposed sensitive customer information.
  • [Nov 24, 7:30 PM] Google and Accel's AI Initiative in India: Google and venture capital firm Accel have partnered to launch the 'AI Futures Fund' to invest up to $2 million in early-stage AI startups in India.
  • [Nov 25, 7:00 AM] The AI Boom's Foundational Flaws: A new analysis from The Verge explores the fundamental mistakes and misconceptions driving the current AI boom, questioning whether large language models can truly achieve the intelligence that tech CEOs are promising.
  • [Nov 24, 10:15 AM] Former MrBeast Strategist's AI Tool for Creators: A former content strategist for YouTuber MrBeast is developing an AI-powered tool called 'Palo' to help creators with ideation and analytics for short-form video content.
  • [Nov 24, 11:15 AM] New AI Benchmark for Human Well-being: A new AI benchmark called 'HumaneBench' has been introduced to evaluate how well AI chatbots protect and support human well-being, moving beyond traditional measures of intelligence and instruction-following.
  • [Nov 25, 12:00 AM] Anthropic's New AI Model and Cybersecurity Concerns: Anthropic has released its latest AI model, but the launch is accompanied by concerns about its potential misuse in cybersecurity attacks.
  • [Nov 24, 7:30 AM] Rocket Lab's Neutron Delays: Rocket Lab's CEO, Peter Beck, discussed the delays in the development of the Neutron rocket, while also commenting on the success of Blue Origin's New Glenn and the future of NASA science missions.
  • [Nov 24, 6:00 PM] Anthropic introduces Opus 4.5: Anthropic has released Opus 4.5, a new version of its AI model, with reduced API pricing and the ability to handle much longer conversations.
conspiracies:
• [Nov 25, 2025, 12:29 PM] Theory: Trump Administration sources claim a rogue faction within the CIA is actively planning a coup to destabilize the government. This internal threat is allegedly preparing for a significant 'bad event' that will be blamed on the President to justify their actions.
  • [Nov 25, 2025, 11:59 AM] Theory: Following former FBI Director James Comey's criminal case being thrown out, new footage has emerged showing him allegedly bragging about the successful weaponization of the Justice System against political opponents, suggesting a deep-state conspiracy against Trump supporters.
  • [Nov 25, 2025, 9:44 AM] Theory: CIA sources are warning of an imminent false flag event. A recently surfaced Democrat sedition video is believed to be part of a larger psychological operation to prepare the public for a major destabilizing event that will be falsely attributed to President Trump.
  • [Nov 25, 2025, 8:30 AM] Theory: Germany's government has reportedly increased its funding for speech control and censorship by fivefold. This is seen as an effort to muzzle dissent and control the public narrative under the guise of combating hate speech, creating a state-sponsored censorship apparatus.
  • [Nov 25, 2025, 7:55 AM] Theory: As President Trump is scheduled to meet with Zelensky to negotiate a peace deal for the Ukraine conflict, there is a growing belief that European leaders are actively working to sabotage the talks. The theory suggests they will not accept any resolution that does not exclusively benefit European interests, even if it means prolonging the war.
  • [Nov 20, 2025, 2:14 PM] Theory: The cover of The Economist's 2026 'The World Ahead' edition contains cryptic symbols and dire predictions. Analysts suggest it hints at upcoming global events, including economic turmoil and political unrest, all orchestrated by a hidden global elite.
  • [Nov 13, 2025, 1:27 PM] Theory: A deep dive into the mysterious 'Finders' group has resurfaced, exposing an alleged powerful network involved in child abduction, mind control, and satanic rituals. The theory claims the case was one of the biggest cover-ups in U.S. history, protecting influential figures.
  • [Nov 12, 2025, 10:15 AM] Theory: A prediction from 'The Simpsons' is circulating, which suggests that on November 12th, 2025, a major global event will cause everything to 'stop'. Speculation ranges from a worldwide power outage to a financial system collapse.
  • [Nov 5, 2025, 4:35 PM] Theory: The latest 'Symbolic Pics of the Month' analysis reveals hidden occult messages in popular culture. This month's focus is on Cardi B's pregnancy photoshoot and Justin Bieber's recent photos, which are said to contain satanic and illuminati symbolism.
  • [Jul 6, 2023, 3:00 PM] Theory: The long-standing 'Project Blue Beam' theory has seen a resurgence in discussion, with many believing the faked alien invasion event is imminent and will be staged by the end of 2025 to usher in a one-world authoritarian government.
